extendedIngredients.name: noodles
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 oz no bake whole wheat lasgana noodles, broken up

extendedIngredients.name: pasta sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 cups (1lbs 9 oz jar) Pasta Sauce (I used Whole Foods Roasted Vegetable)

recipes.title: Skillet Meat Lasagna #SundaySupper

winePairing.pairingText: Lasagne can be paired with Montepulciano, Sangiovese, and Chianti. Lasagna pairs well with medium-bodied red wine with higher acidity. Sangiovese, Montepulciano, and Chianti all fit the bill. The Valle Reale Vigneto di Popoli Montepulciano d'Abruzzo with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Valle Reale Vigneto di Popoli Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
productMatches.description: At 1,000 feet above sea level, Valle Reale's vineyards are nestled into one of Italy's most beautifulnational parks. This rich 100% Montepulciano d'Abruzzo is made from the oldest estate vineyards,planted back in 1975 on soils rich in chalk, clay and pebbles. Harvested by hand in the second partof October, the grapes are gently pressed and macerated with the skins for 1012days to ensureideal color concentration and structure. After full malolactic fermentation in barrels, the wine ismatured for one more year in the same French barriques and then refined in bottle for another eightmonths.Valle Reale introduces the wine lover to a new breed of Montepulciano. Surprisingly concentrated,with silky tannins and layers of dark berry fruit and spices, this is a rich and aromatic Montepulcianod'Abruzzo. Fullbodiedand firm, yet supple, it is ready to be enjoyed with hearty pasta dishes,roasted poultry or lamb, and ribs.

recipes.instructions: In a skillet add ground beef, garlic, and onion and cook until beef is no longer pink, breaking up any large chunks. Drain the fat.Add half the jar pasta sauce to meat mixture; mix until combined. Drop chunks of ricotta cheese over meat and then add lasagna noodles, covering some of it with the meat. Add remaining pasta sauce and top with mozzarella cheese. Set burner to low, cover pan with a lid and bake until noodles are soft and cheese is melted; about 15 minutes. Check pasta with a fork.Let it cool for a couple of minutes and serve.

steps.step: In a skillet add ground beef, garlic, and onion and cook until beef is no longer pink, breaking up any large chunks.
Add half the jar pasta sauce to meat mixture; mix until combined. Drop chunks of ricotta cheese over meat and then add lasagna noodles, covering some of it with the meat.
Add remaining pasta sauce and top with mozzarella cheese. Set burner to low, cover pan with a lid and bake until noodles are soft and cheese is melted; about 15 minutes. Check pasta with a fork.
Let it cool for a couple of minutes and serve.
